alert.note: Alert for Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 6:11AM EST until January 28 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding along Irondequoit Creek. * WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following county, Monroe. * WHEN...Until 145 PM EST This Afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. High levels on the creek will result in flooding at Ellison Park, and along Blossom Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 603 AM EST, Excessive runoff from snowmelt and heavy rain Friday will continue to produce flooding today along Irondequoit Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rochester, Irondequoit, East Rochester, Fairport, Brighton and Penfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
